articles.title: NASA sends squid from Hawaii into space for research - The Associated Press
articles.description: HONOLULU (AP) — Dozens of baby squid from Hawaii are in space for study.  The baby Hawaiian bobtail squid were raised at the University of Hawaii's Kewalo Marine Laboratory and were blasted into space earlier this month on a SpaceX resupply mission to the Int…

articles.title: Clash of the Titans: Hubble telescope captures cataclysmic cosmic collision of galaxy pair on verge of merging - RT
articles.description: With the aid of the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope, astronomers have captured a new photo of a collision in the IC 1623 galaxy system. The galaxy pair is in its final stages of merging, which will then create new star formations.
articles.content:
The collision of the galaxy pair featured as Picture of the Week for Hubble, captioned “Clash of the Titans” on Monday.

articles.title: Stunning Strawberry Moon will glow a golden hue in the night sky THURSDAY - Daily Mail
articles.description: The Strawberry Moon will be visible Wednesday, but will peak Thursday at 2:40pm. However, the stunning supermoon will not be visible on the horizon until later Thursday evening.
articles.content:
A Strawberry Moon will light up the sky on Thursday, June 24 and will be the last supermoon for the year.

articles.title: Climate change is NOT to blame for birds shrinking in size, scientists say - Daily Mail
articles.description: North American migratory birds are changing in size and shape independently of changes in their migration timing, report University of Michigan scientists.

articles.title: Scientists Perplexed by Galaxy Without Dark Matter Galaxy (UDG) - Interesting Engineering
articles.description: The new study improves on results published in 2019, based on 12 Hubble orbits and TRGB analysis, that confirmed that another neighboring galaxy UDG NGC1052-DF4 (DF4) also lacked dark matter.
